publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-210 Richard Lochhead: RAF Buchan—That the Parliament takes note of the strong case for retaining RAF Buchan as outlined in Aberdeenshire Council’s submission to the review of the UK’s Air Surveillance and Control Systems and expresses concern at the threat to local employment and the local economy that would result if RAF Buchan was to be closed. Supported by: Brian Adam*

S1M-210 Richard Lochhead: RAF Buchan—That the Parliament takes note of the strong case for retaining RAF Buchan as outlined in Aberdeenshire Council’s submission to the review of the UK’s Air Surveillance and Control Systems and expresses concern at the threat to local employment and the local economy that would result if RAF Buchan was to be closed. Supported by: Brian Adam
S1M-210 RAF Buchan (lodged on 20 October 1999) Irene McGugan*
S1M-210 RAF Buchan (lodged on 20 October 1999) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-210 RAF Buchan (lodged on 20 October 1999) Alasdair Morgan*

S1M-210 Richard Lochhead: RAF Buchan—That the Parliament takes note of the strong case for retaining RAF Buchan as outlined in Aberdeenshire Council’s submission to the review of the UK’s Air Surveillance and Control Systems and expresses concern at the threat to local employment and the local economy that would result if RAF Buchan was to be closed. Supported by: Brian Adam, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Alasdair Morgan

S1M-210 Richard Lochhead: RAF Buchan—That the Parliament takes note of the strong case for retaining RAF Buchan as outlined in Aberdeenshire Council’s submission to the review of the UK’s Air Surveillance and Control Systems and expresses concern at the threat to local employment and the local economy that would result if RAF Buchan was to be closed. Supported by: Brian Adam, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Alasdair Morgan
S1M-210 RAF Buchan (lodged on 20 October 1999) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-210 RAF Buchan (lodged on 20 October 1999) Ben Wallace*R

S1M-210 Richard Lochhead: RAF Buchan-That the Parliament takes note of the strong case for retaining RAF Buchan as outlined in Aberdeenshire Council's submission to the review of the UK's Air Surveillance and Control Systems and expresses concern at the threat to local employment and the local economy that would result if RAF Buchan was to be closed. Supported by: Brian Adam, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Alasdair Morgan, Andrew Wilson, Ben Wallace R

S1M-210 Richard Lochhead: RAF Buchan—That the Parliament takes note of the strong case for retaining RAF Buchan as outlined in Aberdeenshire Council’s submission to the review of the UK’s Air Surveillance and Control Systems and expresses concern at the threat to local employment and the local economy that would result if RAF Buchan was to be closed. Supported by: Brian Adam, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Alasdair Morgan, Andrew Wilson, Ben Wallace R
S1M-210 RAF Buchan (lodged on 20 October 1999) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-210 Richard Lochhead: RAF Buchan—That the Parliament takes note of the strong case for retaining RAF Buchan as outlined in Aberdeenshire Council’s submission to the review of the UK’s Air Surveillance and Control Systems and expresses concern at the threat to local employment and the local economy that would result if RAF Buchan was to be closed. Supported by: Brian Adam, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Alasdair Morgan, Andrew Wilson, Ben Wallace R, Mr David Davidson
